thread.title: What would happen to foreign nationals living in the UK if we vote to leave the EU?
thread.title_full: What would happen to foreign nationals living in the UK if we vote to leave the EU?

author: Jonathan Walker
title: What would happen to foreign nationals living in the UK if we vote to leave the EU?

organizations.name: cudham church of england primary school

text:
What would happen to foreign nationals living in the UK if we vote to leave the EU? 12:44, 23 Jun 2016 12:44, 23 Jun 2016 By Jonathan Walker There has been a lot of speculation over what could happen to people since campaigning began - but how much is true and what is scaremongering? Shares Comments Get daily news by email Nigel Farage, leader of UKIP and Vote Leave campaigner, talks to the media after registering his vote in the UK's EU referendum, at his local polling station Cudham Church of England Primary School on June 23, 2016 in Westerham, England 
There’s been a lot of speculation about what could happen to people from European Union countries currently living in the UK, if we vote ‘Leave’ in the EU referendum . 
But how much of what’s been said is accurate, and what is simple scaremongering? 
We take a brief look at the issue. What is the current situation? 
At the moment, almost anyone from any EU country has the right to come and work in the UK. 
Of course, it works both ways. Brits can also go and work in EU countries. Video loading Click to play Tap to play The Live Event you are trying to watch is either unavailable or has not started Please refresh this page in your browser to reload this live event video What have people been saying? 
Some people, including supporters of the Remain campaign, have suggested that if we vote for Brexit then citizens of other EU countries could be forced to leave the UK. 
The good news is that this is untrue. It’s just one of many scare stories put out by campaigners - on both sides of the argument - in the EU referendum campaign. What would a Leave vote mean? 
Quitting the EU would allow a British Government to impose controls on immigration from EU countries. 
But it wouldn’t force us to do that. It would simply give us the choice. 
And it certainly wouldn’t force any Government to deport people who are already here. So would foreign nationals be kicked out? 
People from EU countries who are living and working in the UK came here legally, under the rules that existed when they arrived. They wouldn’t have to leave. 
No Government is going to tell British businesses who currently have staff from other parts of the Europe that they have to lose their staff. 
MP Gisela Stuart, chair of the Leave campaign and herself a migrant from Germany, points out that the Leave campaign has never talked about deporting people. 
So everyone can relax - there’s no need to pack a suitcase just yet.
